text: she her sister her daughter are on a
rescue mission in the hope their parents
made it through the storm
they brought a car with food and water
but don't know what to expect on the
road ahead we just come here to rescue
my family because they don't have food
no more they've told I heard from the
social networks Facebook is the Sun is a
reality is no more food nothing nothing
to do so that's why we risk your family
I don't know if they're alive or no we
don't have any connection yet we
followed them on the road north it's now
a familiar sight
house after house destroyed trees ripped
up and tossed aside electricity cables
down and hanging in the road the same
landscape for mile after mile the reason
that Communications have been so bad of
course is because the mobile phone masts
have all come down roads have been
blocked until quite recently if people
have family members they haven't heard
from the only thing they can do is to
come out looking for them to these
remote areas and because such a huge
area of the central Philippines was
affected getting aid out to all these
far-flung places it's proving slow
afternoon turn tonight the road worsened
as we got near to the family home they
didn't know what to expect
seeing all the damage but then
a family reunited everyone's fine
their homes were destroyed there's
little food nor sign of aid but they
survived I'm very happy sir they're
alive the whole area is alive that's why
that's most important to me and for my
family and my neighborhood here one
family story among millions in the trail
of chaos the storm left behind
